name: Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension with Venous Sinus Stenosis
chief_complaint: Persistent headaches and blurred vision, especially when lying down
treatment: Venous sinus stenting if refractory to medical management
prognosis: Variable; may lead to permanent vision loss if untreated, but often manageable with therapy
description: A condition of elevated intracranial pressure without identifiable cause, often associated with venous outflow obstruction. Characterized by headache, visual disturbances, and papilledema. MRV typically demonstrates transverse sinus stenosis.
multiple_choice: Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension with Venous Sinus Stenosis
